summary: Maisie: In my case, Arya has a development that has a lot of reminiscence at the beginning of the show. In fact, after reading...
body:
Maisie: In my case, Arya has a development that has a lot of reminiscence at the beginning of the show. In fact, after reading the script, I went to my house and watched the entire first season. I needed to see the beginning of each arc and each decision that Arya was taking, because the big difference with the other seasons, is that there will be no loose ends. [x]

im actually……………………dare i say it……….hyped by this?????? ok  im just throwing it out there: s1 for arya ended with her and gendry hitting the road together. IM JUST SAYING

blog.name: princessaryathevaliant
blog.title: Princess Arya the Valiant
blog.description: A devoted fan defending her precious cinnamon roll, its all you need to know!...and i love cheesecake...bye. Currently on hiatus.

summary: She pushed upon both doors at once with the flat of her gloved hands, but neither one would budge. Locked and barred.“Let me in,...
body:
She pushed upon both doors at once with the flat of her gloved hands, but neither one would budge. Locked and barred.“Let me in, you stupid,” she said. “I crossed the narrow sea.” She made a fist and pounded. “Jaqen told me to come. I have the iron coin.” She pulled it from her pouch and held it up. “See? Valar morghulis.”

I sometimes forget Arya is only 11, but then i get stuff like this. “Let me in, you stupid.” So freaking cute. My smol bean is too precious. 😂😍😍

reblog.comment:

tags: i see people use that passage to argue that same point all the time
another on the block list lol
i need to stop checking her tag tho like what a nightmare
summary: idk why im bothering to point out the obvious here but septon meribald is not a reliable source of information re: nymeria’s...
body:
idk why im bothering to point out the obvious here but septon meribald is not a reliable source of information re: nymeria’s pack. his statement on them is actually a blatant example of “the unreliability of a story” which grrm uses often. (see also: the varying inaccurate accounts of robert and joffreys deaths) meribald has no eyes within this wolf pack therefore he knows nothing of their experiences. but arya does. we have a direct link to the pack through her and we can see the inconsistencies. ie: the wolf pack doesnt just “devour” man flesh but birds, horses and sheep. because they are animals. they eat what they can get. and generally, in nymeria’s own words:  

“Men on horses […] Some of her younger brothers bared their teeth to defend the food they’d found, but she snapped at them until they scattered. That was the way of the wild. Deer and hares and crows fled before wolves, *and wolves fled from men.”

but the people of westeros still see them as monsters and it shows in their tales. this is how wolves have been treated throughout human history and its why theyve been so viciously hunted to the point of extinction in many places. they are deeply misunderstood. nymeria is not an evil demon from “the seventh hell” who eats babies. she is an alpha wolf who protects and provides for her pack. thats who arya is too.

*unless theyre fucking with arya stark

summary: When Ned is watching Arya in her “dancing lesson” he has a moment of ptsd. He begins to genuinely hear an actual war. The real...
body: When Ned is watching Arya in her “dancing lesson” he has a moment of ptsd. He begins to genuinely hear an actual war. The real swords begin to clang; not just the wooden ones she is using. It’s a profound moment when you really pay attention. He is remembering a horrible thing and it’s also a premonition of what is to come, for everyone, including Arya.

reblog.comment: When Ned is watching Arya in her “dancing lesson” he has a moment of ptsd. He begins to genuinely hear an actual war. The real swords begin to clang; not just the wooden ones she is using. It’s a profound moment when you really pay attention. He is remembering a horrible thing and it’s also a premonition of what is to come, for everyone, including Arya.

summary: 👏Nymeria and Arya have a special bond 👏They are connected even when Arya is across the narrow sea and Nymeria is roaming the...
body: 👏Nymeria and Arya have a special bond 👏They are connected even when Arya is across the narrow sea and Nymeria is roaming the wilds of the Riverlands👏 She is a part of Arya’s soul👏It’s through her that Grrm first introduced the concept of “love” in Arya’s life ( Arya is already in love)👏 It’s through Nymeria that Arya pulls out her mother’s corpse from the river👏 Nymeria wanted Catlyn to rise, to run and to eat with them👏 Nymeria is the symbolization of Arya herself👏 Nymeria loves Arya👏SHE LOVES ARYA AND ARYA LOVES HER TOO👏 SO FUCK D&D, NYMERIA IS NOT GOING TO LEAVE ARYA WHEN THEY MEET AGAIN 👏

blog.name: silkygoldmilkweed
blog.title: sansa stark & sandor clegane are soulmates

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: I have bad news and I’m sorry
title: I have bad news and I’m sorry
body:
I don’t think Arya and Gendry are going to live happily ever after. Arya’s “not domesticated” and she’s not going to be. Also this:

“Nice, though. A nice oak tree.” He stepped closer, and sniffed at her. “You even smell nice for a change.” “You don’t. You stink.” Arya shoved him back against the anvil and made to run, but Gendry caught her arm. She stuck a foot between his legs and tripped him, but he yanked her down with him, and they rolled across the floor of the smithy. He was very strong, but she was quicker. Every time he tried to hold her still she wriggled free and punched him. Gendry only laughed at the blows, which made her mad. He finally caught both her wrists in one hand and started to tickle her with the other, so Arya slammed her knee between his legs, and wrenched free. Both of them were covered in dirt, and one sleeve was torn on her stupid acorn dress. “I bet I don’t look so nice now,” she shouted. (A Storm of Swords - Arya IV)

and this

“I have been spared that, Seven save me, but I have heard them in the night, and more than once. So many voices…a sound to curdle a man’s blood. It even set Dog to shivering, and Dog has killed a dozen wolves.” He ruffled the dog’s head. “Some will tell you that they are demons. They say the pack is led by a monstrous she-wolf, a stalking shadow grim and grey and huge. They will tell you that she has been known to bring aurochs down all by herself, that no trap nor snare can hold her, that she fears neither steel nor fire, slays any wolf that tries to mount her, and devours no other flesh but man.” (A Feast for Crows - Brienne V)

Arya is wild. Arya is free. Marriage and a settled life are not a proper match for this girl. She’s been telling us since season one. Please listen to her.

blog.name: silkygoldmilkweed
blog.title: sansa stark & sandor clegane are soulmates

summary: This scene harkens back to season one. We last saw Nymeria when Arya made her run away because she wanted to save Nymeria’s...
text: This scene harkens back to season one. We last saw Nymeria when Arya made her run away because she wanted to save Nymeria’s life, when Cersei was gonna kill her if she found her. When she finally finds Nymeria again, or Nymeria finds her, and she of course wants her to come back home with her and be her loyal companion again, but Nymeria’s found her own life. ‘That’s not you’ is a direct reference to what Arya herself said to her father when her father painted this picture for her of this life she could have as a lady of a castle and marrying some lord and wearing a nice frilly dress. Arya’s not domesticated and it makes total sense that her wolf wouldn’t be either and once the wolf walks away, at first she’s heartbroken to have come this close but then she realizes the wolf is doing exactly what she would do if she were that wolf.
source: D.B. Weiss, Game of Thrones, Inside the Episode, 7x02 “Stormborn”

reblog.comment: D.B. Weiss, Game of Thrones, Inside the Episode, 7x02 “Stormborn”

summary: UNPOPULAR OPINION: Gendry is the rightful heir of the Seven Kingdoms, NOT Jon. In this world, feudalism rules and Robert...
body: UNPOPULAR OPINION: Gendry is the rightful heir of the Seven Kingdoms, NOT Jon. In this world, feudalism rules and Robert Baratheon was crowned king by conquest. This is how Aegon came to power, well that and dragons. Anyhow, Robert’s firstborn son, eldest son, is Gendry. I doubt bastardy even matters at this point? One could argue, that Gendry was the person that put the entire story in motion. Jon Arryn died following the discovery that Robert’s bastards strongly resemble him. Do we recall that, “The seed is strong.” But I digress. JUST imagine if the conclusion to this story, was that a poor orphaned boy from Flee Bottom became the ruler of Westeros. Not the main character, but the one we least expect to sit on the Iron Throne. Let’s also consider that he’s known hard work, he’s known hunger, he’s been kidnapped, imprisoned and at one point knew he was wanted by Cersei/the Crown. Dead or alive for all he knows. Gendry truly knows the plight of lowborns. So, what better person to rule? Sure, Gendry doesn’t know diddly squat about running a kingdom, or the rules of court but there’s the small council and that’s why he marries a certain Northern girl; who knows the ins and outs of highborn life. Arya experienced must strife with Gendry and together they wouldn’t fail the people. Hell, they’d shake things up and if anyone would get rid of monarchy it’d be Arya and Gendry.
